instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
No oxidation, no USB activity, cooler spins. Replaces u7400 and r7402,03, the CPUIMVP_TONA voltage 0.67V , I found too low.
Voltage: PPbus_g3h 12.59V; PP3V42_G3H 3.42v; ALL_SYS_PWRGD 3.3v; PLT_RESET_L 3.3v;PPVCORE_S0_CPU 0.87V.

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
Does VCORE drop from 1.15V to 0.87V?
If yes, board should boot.
Are you sure no USB activity?
Try PC3-10600 RAM modules, one at a time on each slot.
Did you try PRAM reset?

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message: There is no activity on USB.  I tested a memory in each slot.  I will reset the PRAM when I get to the service.

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
"Does VCORE drop from 1.15V to 0.87V?"
Or it starts directly with 0.87V???

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
Board doesn't boot with new file?
I just swapped Fsys area from the file you sent.

PCH heats on these boards, as doesn't have any heatsink...

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message: when I test with the multimeter in the CPUIMVP_TONA mesh the mac turns on, strange. Replaces the u7400 and r7403/02, but still with the defect.

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
You said that it worked before, after replaced U6100.
Did you try the same file now???

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message: When I started to do the analysis it didn't show image and without activity in the USB, it replaces the u7400 and the resistors, I didn't have result. Then,  replaces the u6100, the mac showed white screen, and was locked in the PRAM reset sound, after a certain time it did not give more image. I recorded the BIOS file you sent me and used another BIOS chip, but it didn't work.

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
Try one RAM module (known good) on each slot at a time.

Do you still note the drop pulse on VCORE?

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
The mac displays an image, but when I select MacOS, it freezes. And most of the time it doesn't give an image. Vcore 1.12V after a few seconds it drops to 0.87V. It looks like a RAM or CPU defect.
   I tested with RAM 10600 and 12800 module.

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
"Vcore 1.12V after a few seconds it drops to 0.87V"
That is normal behaviour and I explained to you several times!
The drop voltage, means the board is booting.
However board can get stuck after few seconds; have to find a reason for that.
Did you reball SMC?

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message: Not yet. I'll do that.

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message: I changed the SMC, in the tests the board is with the same defect. In SMC it had a relief in one of the pads, so I replaced it.

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message: Do you get the same voltages like before?

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
Vcore 1.12V
PPbus_g3h 12.60
All_Sys 3.30V
PLt_reset 3.3V

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
Board doesn't boot if VCORE stays at 1.12V.
I supposed wou already understood that.

Could be a simple bad resistor, until bad CPU.
Re-check all the job did on the board.
Be sure all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces are good.
Did you note droping voltage at pins 5 & 6 of U6100?

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message: YES, I already intended that Vcore has to stay between 0.85 and 0.9V. No RAM beep when you remove the memories. The pins 5 and 6 of the u6100 stay 0V, with pulse: pin 5 1.46V and 6 1.09V;

threads.title: 820-3115 No image, on USB
threads.message:
"Replaces u7400 and r7402,03, the CPUIMVP_TONA voltage 0.67V , I found too low."
Not low at all, really.
Be sure you've soldered correct values for R7402/03.
Check other job you did on the board too.
